title: Midbrain dopaminergic differentiation of human pluripotent stem cells
title_html: Midbrain dopaminergic differentiation of human pluripotent stem cells

authors.name: Tilo Kunath
authors.affiliation: MRC Centre for Regenerative Medicine, Institute for Stem Cell Research, University of Edinburgh

source.description: Prepare a 10 mM SB431542 solution.

To prepare 1190 µl of 10 mM SB431542:
Add
(2 x
) of DMSO (
Sigma Aldrich, cat no. D2650
) directly to vial containing
of SB431542 (
Merck Millipore, cat no. 616461-5MG
) and mix by pipetting until powder is completely dissolved.
Prepare
-
aliquots of 10 mM SB431542 in sterile 1.5-ml Eppendorfs tubes and store at
for up to one year. Once thawed, keep SB431542 aliquot at
in the dark for up to two weeks.

Prepare 10 mM (100,000x) and 0.1 mM (1000x) stocks of LDN193189.
C25H22N6. MW: 406.48 g/mol.

To prepare 492 µl of 10 mM LDN193189:
Add
of DMSO (
Sigma Aldrich, cat no. D2650
) directly to vial containing
of LDN193189 (
Miltenyi Biotec, cat no. 130-103-925
) to obtain a
solution. Warm briefly (3-5min) at
to dissolve powder.
Alternatively, LDN193189 can be obtained in solution at 10 mM in DMSO (
Miltenyi Biotec, cat no. 130-106-540
).
Dilute 10 mM LDN193189 at 1 in 100 with DMSO (
Sigma Aldrich, cat no. D2650
) to create
(1000x) stocks.
Prepare
-
aliquots of 0.1 mM LDN193189 in sterile 1.5-ml Eppendorfs tubes and store at
for up to one year. Once thawed, keep LDN193189 aliquot at
in the dark for up to two weeks.
Prepare 600 µg/ml (1000x) stock of Sonic Hedgehog (SHH-C24II).

To prepare 833 µl of 600 µg/ml SHH-C24II:
Add volume of
of DPBS without Mg2+ and Ca2+ (
Thermo Fisher, Cat no 14190086
) directly to vial containing
of SHH-C24II (
R+D Systems, cat no. 1845-SH-500
).
Add
of 7.5% BSA (
Sigma Aldrich, cat no. A8412-100ML
) directly to the vial.
Mix by pipetting up and down several times until the powder is dissolved.
Prepare
-
aliquots of
SHH in sterile 1.5-ml Eppendorfs tubes and store at
for up to one year. Once thawed, keep SHH aliquot at
for up to two weeks.
Prepare 10 mM stock of CHIR99021.

To prepare 2414 µl of 10mM CHIR99021:
Add
of DMSO (
Sigma Aldrich, cat no. D2650
) directly to vial containing
of CHIR99021 (
Miltenyi Biotech, Cat no 130-103-926
) to obtain a
solution. Mix by pipetting up and down several times to dissolve the powder. If precipitate is observed, warm briefly (2-5min) at
.
Alternatively, CHIR99021 can be obtained in solution at 10 mM in DMSO (
Miltenyi Biotech, Cat no. 130-106-539
)
Prepare
aliquots of 10 mM CHIR99021 in sterile 1.5-ml Eppendorfs tubes and store at
for up to one year. Once thawed, keep CHIR99021 aliquot at
in the dark for up to two weeks.
Prepare 100 µg/ml (1000x) stock of recombinant FGF8b

To prepare 250 µl of 100 µg/ml FGF8b:
Add
of DPBS without Mg2+ and Ca2+ (
Thermo Fisher, Cat no 14190086
) directly to vial containing
of FGF8b (
R+D Systems, Cat no 423-F8-025
)
Add
of 7.5% BSA (
Sigma Aldrich, cat no. A8412-100ML
) directly to the vial.
Mix by pipetting up and down several times to dissolve the powder.
Prepare
-
aliquots of 100 µg/ml FGF8b in sterile 1.5-ml Eppendorfs tubes and store at
for up to one year. Once thawed, keep FGF8b aliquots at
in the dark for up to two weeks.
Prepare 1 mg/ml (1000x) stock of Heparin Sodium Salt from porcine intestinal mucosa

To prepare 55 ml of 1 mg/ml Heparin:
Add
of DPBS without Mg2+ and Ca2+ (
Thermo Fisher, Cat no 14190086
) directly to vial containing
of Heparin (
Sigma Aldrich, Cat no H3149
).
Mix by pipetting up and down several times to dissolve the powder.
Filter the reconstitued Heparin solution using an appropriatly sized syringe for the volume and 0.33µM filter
Prepare
aliquots of
Heparin in sterile 1.5-ml Eppendorfs tubes and store at
for up to two years.
Prepare 20 µg/ml (1000x) stock of recombinant Bone-Derived Growth Factor (BDNF).

To prepare 5 ml of 20 µg/ml BDNF:
Add
of DPBS without Mg2+ and Ca2+ (
Thermo Fisher, Cat no 14190086
) directly to vial containing
of BDNF (
PeproTech, Cat no 450-02
).
Add
of 7.5% BSA (

Mix by pipetting up and down several times to dissolve the powder.
Prepare
-
aliquots of
BDNF in sterile 1.5-ml Eppendorfs tubes and store at
for up to one year. Once thawed, keep BDNF aliquots at
for up to two weeks.
Prepare 20 µg/ml (2000x) stock of recombinant Glial Derived Growth Factor (GDNF).

To prepare 5 ml of 20 µg/ml GDNF:
Add
of DPBS without Mg2+ and Ca2+ (

Add
of 7.5% BSA (

Mix by pipetting up and down several times to dissolve the powder.
Prepare
-
aliquots of
GDNF in sterile 1.5-ml Eppendorfs tubes and store at
for up to one year. Once thawed, keep GDNF aliquots at
for up to two weeks.
Prepare 0.2 M (1000x) stock of Ascorbic Acid by Sigma Aldrich. C6H8O6, MW: 176.12 g/mol.

To prepare 2841 µl 0.2 M Ascorbic Acid:
Add
of sterile water directly to vial containing
of Ascorbic Acid (
Sigma Aldrich, Cat no A4403
).
Mix by pipetting up and down several times to dissolve the powder.
Filter the reconstitued Ascorbic Acid solution using an appropriatly sized syringe for the volume and a 0.33µM filter.
Prepare
-
aliquots of
Ascorbic Acid in sterile 1.5-ml Eppendorfs tubes and store at
for up to one year. Once thawed, keep Ascorbic Acid aliquots at
in the dark for up to two weeks.
Prepare 0.5 M (1000x) stock of dcAMP (N6,2′-O-Dibutyryladenosine 3′,5′-cyclic monophosphate sodium salt) by Sigma Aldrich. C18H23N5O8PNa, MW: 491.3 g/mol.

To prepare 4070 µl 0.5 M dcAMP:
Add
of sterile water directly to vial containing
of dcAMP (
Sigma Aldrich, Cat no D0627
).
Mix by pipetting up and down several times to dissolve the powder.
Filter the reconstitued dcAMP solution using an appropriatly sized syringe for the volume and a 0.33µM filter.
Prepare
-
aliquots of
dcAMP in sterile 1.5-ml Eppendorfs tubes and store at
for up to one year. Once thawed, keep dcAMP aliquots at
in the dark for up to two weeks.

Prepare 10 mM (10,000x) stock of DAPT
C23H26F2N2O4, MW: 432.46 g/mol.

To prepare 2312 µl 10 mM DAPT:
Add
of DMSO (
Sigma Aldrich, cat no. D2650
) directly to vial containing
of DAPT (
Tocris, Cat no 2634
).
Mix by pipetting up and down several times to dissolve the powder. If precipitate is observed, warm the solution to
for 2-5 mins.
Prepare
aliquots of
DAPT in sterile 1.5-ml Eppendorfs tubes and store at
for up to one year. Once thawed, keep DAPT aliquots at
in the dark for up to 1 month.

Prepare 10 mM (1000x) stock of Y-27632 dihydrochloride
C14H21N3O.2HCl. MW: 320.26 g/mol.

To prepare 15.61 ml 10 mM Y-27632:
Add
of DPBS without Mg2+ and Ca2+ (
Thermo Fisher, Cat no 14190086
) directly to vial containing
of Y-27632 dihydrochloride (
Tocris, Cat no 1254
).
Mix by pipetting up and down several times to dissolve the powder.
Prepare aliquots of
Y-27632 dihydrochloride in sterile 1.5-ml Eppendorfs tubes and store at
for up to one year. Prepare smaller
aliquots for working use and larger
aliquots which can be aliquoted out at a later date.
Once thawed, keep Y-27632 aliquots at
in the dark for up to 1 month.

On mDA day 0 cells hPSCs are lifted as clumps using EDTA and seeded onto plates that have been pre-coated with Laminin-111.
Plates need to be coated with Laminin 111 at least 12 hours prior to the beginning the differentiation.

Pre-Coating plates with Laminin 111:
Laminin-111 stocks (0.1mg/ml) (
Biolamina, Cat no LN111
) should be thawed at RT and then diluted 1:20 in DPBS (with Ca2+ and Mg2+) (
ThermoFischer, cat no. 14040083
) to create a final working stock solution of
Laminin-111.
The diluted laminin should be mixed thoroughly and added to the wells at a volume recommended for the well size (see below table).
ABC
1 Plate type Approx Area of Well (cm2)Volume of 5 µg/mll L521 (ul) required for optimal coating
2 24 well plate 2 300
3 48 well plate 1 150
Move the plate gently around to ensure the well is evenly covered
Wrap the plate in parafilm to reduce evaporation
Incubate the plate at
overnight for at least 12 hours (overnight incubation is recommended).
Coated plates can be stored at
for 3 weeks.

ABC
1 Plate type Approx Area of Well (cm2)Volume of 5 µg/mll L521 (ul) required for optimal coating
2 24 well plate 2 300
3 48 well plate 1 150

Preparation of Neural Induction Medium (NIM):
50% DMEM/F12 + 50% Neurobasal + 1x N2 + 1x B27 + 2mM L-Glutamine.
Between mDA D0 and mDA D4 cells are cultured within NIM.
The components which form the base media NIM (N2 supplement, B27 supplement, DMEM/F12 and Neurobasal media) are in themselves only stable for 2 weeks due to the presence of light sensitive components. Thus, fresh base media should be made up at the start of each differentiation and kept in the dark at
for up to 2 weeks.

To prepare 50ml of NIM:
Add
of DMEM/F12 (
Thermo Fisher, Cat no 21331020
) +
of NeurobasalTM Medium (
Thermo Fisher, Cat no 21103049
) +
of 100x N2 (
Thermo Fisher, Cat no 17502048
) +
of 50x B27 (
Thermo Fisher, Cat no 17504044
) +
of 200mM L-Glutamine (
Thermo Fisher, Cat no 25030032
).

mDA Day 0 plating
On mDA Day 0 cells are lifted as clumps using 0.5mM EDTA and then seeded onto Laminin-111 coated plates.
Before beginning; self-renewing cultures of hPSCs must be free of spontaneous differentiation and confluency should be between 70% and 90% before use.
Prior to mDA D0 seeding, human ESC/iPSC cultures are grown on Laminin-521 (5μg/ml) matrix coated 6-well plates with daily feeding using 2 ml StemMACS iPS-BrewXF (Miltenyi Biotec). Each well of a 6-well plate should be pre-coated with 1200 μl of Laminin-521 overnight at 4oC before use to ensure even hPSC adherence and efficient growth. One well of a 6-well plate should provide enough cells to seed between 6 and 10 wells of a 24-well plate
for mDA differentiation.

Preparation of wash media for lifted hPSCs:
Per each well of a 6 well plate of hPSCs prepare 4ml of wash media.
Wash media: 50% iPS-Brew XF medium (self renewal media for hPSCs)
+ 50% DMEM/F12 + 10 μM Y27632.
For example when lifting one well of hPSCs from a 6 well plate prepare:
iPS-Brew XF medium (
Miltenyibiotec, Cat no 130-104-368
) +
DMEM/F12 (
Thermo Fisher, Cat no 21331020
) +
10mM Y27632.

Prepare an adequate volume of plating medium:
Neural Induction Media (NIM) + 10 μM Y27632 + 10 μM SB431542, 100nM LDN, 600 ng/ml Shh and between 0.7 and 1.2 μM CHIR99021*.
To start differentiation in 24-well plates, you will need 400 μl per well.
*The concentration of CHIR99021 recommended can vary between cell lines. A change in 0.1 μM can have a suprisingly large effect on the puritiy of cells obtained. Therefore it is recommended when first starting to try out and compare a range of CHIR99021 concentrations.

Lifting hPSCs with EDTA
Aspirate the iPS-Brew XF medium from the hPSCs (in 6-well plate).
Wash cells once with
of
EDTA (prepared step 16.1).
Add
of
EDTA to the cells and incubate at
for approximately 5-7 minutes or when most of the cells appear ‘refractile’ by light microscopy. *The incubation time should depend on the confluency of the cells.
After the incubation period; remove the EDTA and use
of the Wash medium (prepared in step 18.2) to lift the cells gently from the well. Aim to lift cells in a few pipettes as possible to ensure optimal surivial.
Transfer the lifted cells to the tube with remaining Wash medium.
Gently invert the tube a few times to ensure the cells are thoroughly mixed for cell counting.

Counting the cells:
By using EDTA the cells are lifted as clumps. For more accurate counting of the cells take an aliquot to be broken into single cells.
To count the cells, take 2 x 10 μl aliquots of cells into new 0.5ml Eppendorfs. Mix each with
of Trypan Blue (
Sigma Aldrich, Cat no T8154
).
Count the cells using a haemacytometer*. Calculate the amount of cells within the wash media.

Plating cells:
On mDA Day 0 we recommend using seeding into a 24 well plate.
From the cell count, estimate the total volume of cells you will need to initiate differentiation at a density of 40,000 cells/cm2*.
For example, for 4 wells of a 24-well plate, you will need 4 (number of wells) x 2 (area of each well) x 40,000 (required density) = 320,000 cells.
*Note the optimal plating density can vary depending on the cell line used. For example RC17 a plating density of 40,000 cells/cm2 is recommended but for AST18 a plating density of 60,000cells/cm2 is recommended.
Transfer 110% of the required volume (an extra 10% is transferred to account for any cell death) from the remaining cell suspension within the wash media (that has not been triturated) to a new tube for centrifugation 300 g for 3 minutes.
Aspirate the wash media and resuspend the colonies gently in the plating medium (prepared in step 18.2). It is recommended to plate cells into the wells of a 24 well plate in a volume of 400 μl per well. E.g if 4 wells of a 24-well plate are being seeding for example then cells should be resuspended in 4 x 400 μl.
Aspirate the Laminin-111 from the coated plates and seed the cell suspension into the well. Shake the plate with to ensure an even distribution of cells.

mDA Day 2 media change.
Fresh medium should be prepared from base media NIM and growth factors.

Prepare an adequate volume of fresh day 2 medium:
Neural Induction Media (NIM) + 10 μM SB431542, 100nM LDN, 600 ng/ml SHH and between 0.6 and 1.0 μM CHIR99021.
Prepare medium according to the number of the wells to be fed, remember to account for extra dead volume.
For each well of a 24-well plate
of fresh media is required.

mDA Day 4 media change
Between mDA Day 4 and mDA Day 11 cells are no longer cultured within NIM as a base media but instead are cultured within neural proliferation media NPM.
*You should observe the cells becoming more confluent day by day. We expect cells to be close to 100% confluent between mDA D3 and mDA D7. How quickly cells become confluent varies between cell lines.
The components which form the base media NPM (N2 supplement, B27 supplement, DMEM/F12 and Neurobasal media) are in themselves only stable for 2 weeks due to the presence of light sensitive components. Thus, fresh base media should be made up at the start of each differentiation and kept in the dark at
for up to 2 weeks.

Preparation of NPM
50% NIM + 25% Neurobasal + 25% DMEM/F12 + 2mM L-Glutamine.
To prepare NPM from NIM:
For example, to make
NPM =
NIM +
DMEM/F12 (
Thermo Fisher, Cat no 21331020
) +
NeurobasalTM Medium (
Thermo Fisher, Cat no 21103049
) +
200mM L-Glutamine (
Thermo Fisher, Cat no 25030032
).
Altnatively to make NPM de novo:
50% Neurobasal, 50% DMEM/F12 + 0.5x N2 + 0.5x B27 + 2mM L-Glutamine.
For example, to make
NPM=
of DMEM/F12 (
Thermo Fisher, Cat no 21331020
) +
of NeurobasalTM Medium (
Thermo Fisher, Cat no 21103049
) +
of 100x N2 (
Thermo Fisher, Cat no 17502048
) +
of 50x B27 (
Thermo Fisher, Cat no 17504044
) +
of 200mM L-Glutamine (
Thermo Fisher, Cat no 25030032
).

Prepare an adequate volume of fresh day 4 medium:
NPM + 10 μM SB431542, 100nM LDN, 600 ng/ml Shh and between 0.6 and 1.0 μM CHIR99021.
Prepare medium according to the number of the wells to be fed, remember to account for extra dead volume.
For each well of a 24-well plate
of fresh media is required.

mDA Day 7 media change.
Cells should be confluent by mDA Day 7 at the latest.

Prepare an adequate volume of fresh day 7 medium:
NPM + 10 μM SB431542, 100 nM LDN, 600 ng/ml Shh and between 0.6 and 1.0 μM CHIR99021.
Prepare medium according to the number of the wells to be fed, remember to account for extra dead volume.
For each well of a 24-well plate
of fresh media is required.
mDA Day 9 media change

Prepare an adequate volume of fresh medium:
NPM + 100 ng/ml FGF8b + 1 μM Heparin solution.
Prepare medium according to the number of the wells to be fed, remember to account for extra dead volume.
For each well of a 24-well plate,
of fresh media is required.

mDA Day 11
On mDA day 11 cells can either be replated or frozen for use later on. From mDA D11 onwards cells are cultured within new base media; Neural differentiation medium (NDM). mDA cells should be replated onto new plates freshly coated Laminin-111.

Pre-coating plates with Laminin-111
Plates should be coated with L111 following the same protocol as step ?

mDA D11 replating:
On day 11 cells can be (i) lifted and replated for continued differentiation, or (ii) cryopreserved
To replate; mDA D11 cells are lifted as single cells using Acctuase and replated into a new L111-coated plate at a density of 800,000cells/cm2.

Preparation of wash medium:
NPM + 10 μM Y27632
For each well of a 24 well plate prepare
wash media. *This volume is 5x the volume of Acctuase added per well.

Preparation of plating medium:
NDM + 10 μM Y-27632 + 20 ng/ml BDNF + 10 ng/ml GDNF 100 ng/ml FGF8b + 0.2 mM Ascorbic Acid + 1 μg/ml heparin solution.
Prepare plating medium according to the number of the wells to be re-plated, remember to account for extra dead volume.
It is recommended to re-plate cells into either a 24 or 48 well formatt.
Volume for day 11 plating:
ABC
1µl/wellarea (cm2)Volume (µl)
224 well plate2600
348 well plate1300

ABC
1µl/wellarea (cm2)Volume (µl)
224 well plate2600
348 well plate1300

Lifting cells as single cells with Accutase
Wash the cells once briefly Accutase (300 µl/well for 24-well plate) (
Sigma Aldrich, Cat no A6964
)
Add 300µl/well of Accutase (
Sigma Aldrich, Cat no A6964
) and incubate
for 10min.
Following the incubation period, to dissociate into single cells pipette up and down. *
*Place a P1000 tip in a P200 tip, set the P1000 to 600. Tilt the plate towards you, place the pipette tip in the bottom corner of the well . Pipetting the cells up and down against this corner will aid in breaking up the cells. Pipetting ~15 times is usually sufficient to break into single cells. Try to avoid the production of bubbles where possible.
Transfer the lifted cells to the wash media.
Repeat the process for each well.

Counting cells
To count the cells, take 2 x 10 μl aliquots of cells into new 0.5ml Eppendorfs. Mix each with
of Trypan Blue (
Sigma Aldrich, Cat no T8154
).
Count the cells using a haemacytometer*. Calculate the amount of cells within the wash media.
*Alternatively, can use automatic cell counter to count the cells. E.g TC20TM Automated Cell Counter Biorad (
BioRad, Cat no 1450102
).

Plating cells:
From the cell count, estimate the total volume of cells needed for re-plating. For mDA day 11 replate at a density of 800,000 cells/cm2.
For example: cells needed = (number of wells) x 2cm2 (area of a well in a 24-well plate) x 800,000 cells/cm2 (required density). The volume to spin down = cells needed / cell count.
Transfer the required volume from the remaining cell suspension within the wash media (that has not been triturated) to a new tube for centrifugation 300 g for 3 minutes.
Aspirate the wash media and resuspend the colonies gently in the mDA Day 11 plating medium (prepared in step 24.2). E.g if 4 wells of a 24-well plate are being seeding for example then cells should be resuspended in 4 x 600 μl.
Aspirate the Laminin-111 from the coated plates and seed the cell suspension into the wells. Shake the plate to ensure even distribution of cells.

Alternative to replating: freezing mDA Day 11 cells
Instead of replating cells can be cyropreserved at this stage.
See cryopreservation protocol described in:
https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2020.02.11.944272v1
.
mDA Day 14 media change.

Prepare an adequate volume of fresh medium:
NDM + 20 ng/ml BDNF + 10 ng/ml GDNF + 100 ng/ml FGF8b + 0.2 mM Ascorbic Acid + 1 μg/ml heparin solution.
Prepare medium according to the number of the wells to be fed, remember to account for extra dead volume.
Volume needed per well:
ABC
1Plate Typearea (cm2)Volume (µl/ well)
224 well plate2600
348 well plate1300

ABC
1Plate Typearea (cm2)Volume (µl/ well)
224 well plate2600
348 well plate1300

mDA Day 16 replating preparation
On mDA day 16 cells can either be replated or cyropreserved for use later on. mDA cells should be replated onto new plates freshly coated Laminin-111.

Pre-coating plates with Laminin-111
Plates should be coated with L111 following the same protocol as step 15.

mDA Day 16 replating
On day 16 cells can be (i) lifted and replated for continued differentiation, (ii) cryopreserved, or (iii) transplanted into an animal model.
As with mDA Day 11 replating, mDA Day 16 cells are lifted as single cells using Acctuase and replated into a new L111-coated plate at a density of 800,000 cells/cm2.

Preparation of wash media:
Wash media is prepared from NDM + 10 μM Y-27632.
For each well of a 24-well plate prepare
wash media.
For each well of a 48-well plate prepare
wash media.
*This volume is 5x the volume of Acctuase added per well.

Lifting cells as single cells with Accutase
Aspirate off the NDM from each well.
Wash the cells once briefly Accutase (300 µl/well for 24-well plate, 150 µl/well for 48-well plate) (
Sigma Aldrich, Cat no A6964
) to remove excess medium.
Add Accutase (300 µl/well for 24-well plate, 150 µl/well for 48-well plate) (
Sigma Aldrich, Cat no A6964
) and incubate
for 10 mins.
Following the incubation period, to dissociate into single cells pipette up and down. ***
***Place a P1000 tip in a P200 tip, set the P1000 to 600. Tilt the plate towards you, place the pipette tip in the bottom corner of the well pipetting the cells up and down against this corner will aid in breaking up the cells. Pipetting ~15 times is usually sufficient. Try to avoid the production of bubbles.
Transfer the lifted cells to the wash media.
Repeat the process for each well.

Counting cells
To count the cells, take 2 x 10 μl aliquots of cells into new 0.5ml Eppendorfs. Mix each with
of Trypan Blue (
Sigma Aldrich, Cat no T8154
).
Count the cells using a haemacytometer*. Calculate the amount of cells within the wash media.
*Alternatively, can use automatic cell counter to count the cells. E.g TC20TM Automated Cell Counter Biorad (
BioRad, Cat no 1450102
).

Plating cells:
From the cell count, estimate the total volume of cells needed for re-plating. For mDA day 16 replate at a density of 800,000 cells/cm2.
For example: cells needed = (number of wells) x 2 cm2 (area of a well in a 24-well plate) x 800,000 cells/cm2 (required density). The volume to spin down = cells needed / cell count.
Transfer the required volume from the remaining cell suspension within the wash media (that has not been triturated) to a new tube for centrifugation 300 g for 3 minutes.
Aspirate the wash media and resuspend the colonies gently in the mDA Day 16 plating medium (prepared in step 27.2.
E.g if 4 wells of a 24-well plate are being seeding for example then cells should be resuspended in 4 x 600 μl.
Aspirate the Laminin-111 from the coated plates and seed the cell suspension into the wells with generous shaking to ensure even distribution.
mDA Day 18 media change

Prepare an adequate volume of fresh day 18 medium:
NDM + 20 ng/ml BDNF + 10 ng/ml GDNF + 0.2 mM Ascorbic Acid + 0.5 mM dcAMP + 1 µM DAPT.
Prepare medium according to the number of the wells to be fed, remember to account for extra dead volume.
Volume for day 18 media change:
ABC
1Plate Typearea (cm2)Volume (µl/ well)
224 well plate2600
348 well plate1300

ABC
1Plate Typearea (cm2)Volume (µl/ well)
224 well plate2600
348 well plate1300

Media changes mDA day 18-day 45:
From mDA Day 18 onwards cells should be fed every 2-3 days until day 45. At day 45 the mDA cells are expressing high levels of mature mDA markers e.g TH.

Prepare an adequate volume of fresh medium:
NDM + 20 ng/ml BDNF + 10 ng/ml GDNF + 0.2 mM ascorbic acid + 0.5 mM dcAMP + 1 µM DAPT.
Prepare medium according to the number of the wells to be fed, remember to account for extra dead volume.
Volume for media change:
ABC
1Plate Typearea (cm2)Volume (µl/ well)
224 well plate2600
348 well plate1300
mDA neurons can be kept in culture for over 1 year feeding once or twice a week. DAPT should be removed from the feeding medium after day 45.

ABC
1Plate Typearea (cm2)Volume (µl/ well)
224 well plate2600
348 well plate1300

Alternative to replating: freezing mDA Day 16 cells
Instead of replating, cells can be frozen at this stage.
See freezing protocol described in:
https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2020.02.11.944272v1
.

Preparation of plating media:
NDM + 10 μM Y27632 + 20 ng/ml BDNF + 10 ng/ml GDNF + 0.2 mM Ascorbic Acid + 0.5 mM dcAMP + 1 µM DAPT.
Prepare plating medium according to the number of the wells to be re-plated, remember to account for extra dead volume.
It is recommended to re-plate cells into either a 24 or 48-well formatt.
Volume for day 16 plating:
ABC
1Plate Typearea (cm2)Volume (µl/ well)
224 well plate2600
348 well plate1300

ABC
1Plate Typearea (cm2)Volume (µl/ well)
224 well plate2600
348 well plate1300

Prepare aliquots of N2
N2 stocks should be stored at
. To avoid freeze thawing it is helpful to create working aliquots.

Prepare
aliquots of 100x N2 (
Thermo Fisher, Cat 17502048
) in sterile 1.5-ml Eppendorfs tubes and store at
for up to one year.

Prepare aliquots of B27 (without RA)
B27 stocks should be stored at
. To avoid freeze thawing it is helpful to create working aliquots.

Prepare
aliquots of 50x B27 (without RA) (
Thermo Fisher, Cat no 17504044
) in sterile 1.5-ml Eppendorfs tubes and store at
for up to one year.

Preparation of 0.5mM EDTA from ThermoFisher.
To lift hPSCs as clumps for seeding, a stock of 0.5mM EDTA is prepared from 50mM Ultra Pure EDTA (
ThermoFisher, Cat no 15575020
).

To prepare 50ml of 0.5mM EDTA:
Take an
aliquot of
Ultra Pure EDTA (
ThermoFisher, Cat no 15575020
), and add to a 50ml falcon tube.
Add
of DPBS (without Ca2+ and Mg2+) (
ThermoFischer, cat no. 14040083
) directly to the 50ml falcon tube and mix to create a
EDTA stock
Filter the diluted EDTA through a 0.33μM filter into a fresh 50ml falcon tube.
Label and store 0.5 mM EDTA stock at
.
0.5mM EDTA can be kept at
for 6 months.

Preparation of Neural Differentiation Medium (NDM):
The components which form the base media NDM (B27 supplement, and Neurobasal media) are in themselves only stable for 2 weeks due to the presence of light sensitive components. Thus, fresh base media should be made up at the start of each differentiation and kept in the dark at
for up to 2 weeks.

Preparation of NDM:
Neurobasal + 1x B27 + 2mM L-Glutamine.
For example, to make
NDM =
of NeurobasalTM Medium (
Thermo Fisher, Cat no 21103049
) +
of 50x B27 (
Thermo Fisher, Cat no 17504044
) +
of 200mM L-glutamine (
Thermo Fisher, Cat no 25030032
).

Prepare 10 mM (1000x) stock of SB431542.
C22H16N4O3•2H2O. MW: 420.42 g/mol.

materials.name: StemMACS™ iPS-Brew XF human: Basal medium and supplement
Heparin sodium salt from porcine intestinal mucosa
7.5% Bovine Serum Albumin solution in DPBS

description: Differentiation of human embryonic stem cells (hESCs) and human induced pluripotent stem cells (hiPSCs) into midbrain dopaminergic (mDA) neurons is described in this protocol. This protocol has been adapted from published protocols from three laboratories, Lorenz Studer (New York), Malin Parmar/Agnete Kirkeby (Lund), and Su-Chun Zhang (Madison). The relevant papers from these labs are PMIDs: 20362538, 22056989, 22813745, 28094017, 28858290, 22696177. This protocol instructs hESCs and hiPSCs to adopt a midbrain floor plate radial glia-like identity before maturation into mDA neurons with mixed substania nigra pars compacta and ventral tegemental area identity. It has been applied to more than 10 hESC and hiPSC lines in our laboratory, with some cell lines producing exceptional results, and others less so. Our version the protocol is published here PMID: 30472757.
